responses: Our spacecraft was designed by professionals with safety in mind, and no one has been seriously injured on any of our over 30,000 flights. For more information about safety, visit our Safety page.
Our flights are very safe. You are nearly 100 times more likely to die in an hour of driving than in an hour on one of our flights. For more information about safety, visit our Safety page.
We take safety very seriously and ensure all our staff are rigorously trained to maintain our excellent safety record. To learn more, visit our Safety page.
Our safety procedures are constantly reviewed and updated to ensure the safest and most reliable flights possible. To learn more, visit our Safety page.

responses: We are proud to be a carbon negative company. Our spacecraft are reusable and fuel-free, and we donate millions of dollars to environmentally-conscious non-profit organizations each year
We're committed to reducing our carbon footprint and contributing to a sustainable future for our planet.
We believe it's important to protect our environment, and we're constantly looking for ways to minimize our impact and give back to the planet.

patterns: Tell me about the n46x spacecraft

responses: Our flagship rocket model for tourism is the N46x. It represents the pinnacle of spacecraft technology, offering exceptional performance, sustainability, and reusability. The N46x has been carefully selected for tourism purposes, prioritizing safety features and its eco-conscious design.

patterns: how do your rockets handle reentry
how hot do your rockets get when entering the atmosphere
does the rocket land in the water after re-entry
how do your planes and ships not burn up in the atmosphere
will you have to rescue us from the ocean after landing
tell me about how you recover your rockets
responses: Upon re-entry, our spacecraft take advantage of drag to safely enter a glide. From the glide, the spacecraft can land like an airplane, and be reused for another trip.

patterns: how does your rocket take off
Where do the rockets take off from
how do your spacecraft take off
How do your rockets take off
what type of launch mechanism do your rockets and spacecraft use
how many g forces are there on take off
don't you have magnetic launch tracks or something to take off?
how much fuel does it take for your rocket to get to space
tell me about your rocket launches
responses: In order to initiate the launch sequence of our spacecraft, it is securely attached to one of our magnetic tracks located at our airport. This specially designed 2-mile track propels the spacecraft to speeds exceeding 2000 miles per hour (MPH)! Subsequently, the spacecraft utilizes its momentum to ascend like an airplane, reaching the higher layers of the atmosphere. From there, its environmentally friendly electric engines take over, enabling a continued ascent until it ultimately reaches space.

patterns: What do you eat in space

responses: To overcome the challenges associated with fresh food, our meals will be offered in freeze-dried or liquid form. Rest assured, we will provide all necessary sustenance, and the cost of meals is already included in your ticket purchase.
